title: by Section 47 of the Solicitors Act 1954 (as substituted by Section 54 of the
heading: 1. Citation and commencement
text_raw:
1. Citation and commencement 

(a) These Regulations may be cited as the Solicitors Practising 

Certificate (Application Fee) Regulations 2022. 

(b) These Regulations shall apply in respect of the 2023 practice 

year.
text_norm: 1 citation commencement (a) regulation may cited solicitor practising certificate (application fee) regulation 2022 (b) regulation shall apply respect 2023 practice year

title: by Section 47 of the Solicitors Act 1954 (as substituted by Section 54 of the
heading: 2. Definitions
text_raw:
2. Definitions 

(a) 

In these Regulations, except where the context otherwise 
requires: 

"Act of 1960" means the Solicitors (Amendment) Act 1960 
(No. 37 of 1960); 

"Act of 2015" means the Legal Services Regulation Act 2015 
(No. 65 of 2015); 

“application fee” means the total amount of the fees payable in 
respect of any application for a practising certificate, as 
prescribed by the Society from time to time and includes, where 
appropriate and applicable, the registration fee, the contribution 
to the Compensation Fund pursuant to Section 22 of the Act of 
1960, the contribution in respect of the Authority's Levy Fund 
under the Act of 2015 and shall, where applicable, mean the fees 
payable under these Regulations. 

"practice year" means the calendar year; 

"practising certificate" has the meaning given to it in Section 
46 of the Act of 1954; 

"the 2020 Regulations" means 
Certificate Regulations 2020; and 

the Solicitors Practising 

"the 2023 practice year" means the practice year commencing 
on 1 January 2023 and ending on 31 December 2023. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 23rd December, 2022. 

 
 
 
 
 
 [692] 3 

(b) Other words and phrases in these Regulations shall have the 
meanings assigned to them by the Solicitors Acts 1954-2015, 
the Act of 2015 and the 2020 Regulations. 

(c) The Interpretation Act 2005 applies to the interpretation of these 
Regulations as it applies to the interpretation of an Act of the 
Oireachtas.

title: by Section 47 of the Solicitors Act 1954 (as substituted by Section 54 of the
heading: 3. Application Fee
text_raw:
3. Application Fee 

The application fee specified in the Schedule hereto shall be payable in respect 
of applications for practising certificates for the 2023 practice year. 

Signed on behalf of the Law Society of Ireland pursuant to Section 79 of the 
Solicitors Act 1954. 
 16 December 2022 

MAURA DERIVAN, 
 President of the Law Society of Ireland 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [692]
text_norm: 3 application fee application fee specified schedule hereto shall payable respect application practising certificate 2023 practice year signed behalf law society ireland pursuant section 79 solicitor act 1954 16 december 2022 maura derivan president law society ireland 4 692

title: by Section 47 of the Solicitors Act 1954 (as substituted by Section 54 of the
heading: within referred to
text_raw:
SCHEDULE 

within referred to 

E U R O 

(a) Registration Fee for the 2023 practice year payable to the 

1420 

Society on application for a practising certificate by an 
applicant solicitor who has been admitted to the Roll for 
three years or more on 1 January 2023: 

(b) Registration Fee for the 2023 practice year payable to the 

1150 

Society on application for a practising certificate by an 
applicant solicitor who has been admitted to the Roll for 
less than three years on 1 January 2023: 

(c) Contribution to the Compensation Fund for the 2023 

700 

practice year payable to the Society on application for a 
practising certificate by an applicant solicitor: 

(d) Contribution to the Legal Services Regulatory Authority 
Levy Fund for the 2023 practice year payable to the 
Society on application for a practising certificate by an 
applicant solicitor: 

(e) 

(f) 

Fee payable to the Society on each application, pursuant 
to Section 17 of the Solicitors (Amendment) Act 1960, 
for a copy of an entry on File A, File B or File C: 

Fee payable to the Society on each application, pursuant 
to Regulation 11 of the 2020 Regulations, for the issue of 
a duplicate original practising certificate for the 2023 
practice year. 

320 

100 

50
